Link Mash (May 29, 2014)

May 29, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • inessential: Vesper Sync Diary. To most users, an app’s features are a black box: you simply learn about them when they’re released. That said, sometimes it’s fascinating to see the guts; this great series describes how Brent Simmons added synchronization to Vesper (his mobile journal app).
  • Bulk Rename Utility. It might have the most hideous GUI ever, but this is an invaluable tool in the Windows toolkit.
  • Behind the App: The Story of Fantastical. A great 1:1 with the creator of a fantastic (ha!) app. I always love these kinds of development stories.
  • Too Much Information? Facebook, Google Face Backlash Over Logins. This makes a lot of sense; for a few years now, I’ve had a fear of logging into various sites and services via Google, Facebook, etc. I just don’t want them to be involved in what should be an independent session.
  • DuckDuckGo !Bang. It’s official: after nearly 14 years of daily use, I’m leaving Google behind in favor of DuckDuckGo. There are many reasons for this — increased security, better search results, etc. — but this is my favorite: quick searches for a gazillion different services.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.

Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
